Package: grails.plugin.standalone

[Java] Class Launcher

      • grails.plugin.standalone.Launcher

      • Main class; extracts the embedded war and starts Tomcat. Inlines some utility methods since the classpath is limited. Based on org.grails.plugins.tomcat.IsolatedTomcat and org.grails.plugins.tomcat.IsolatedWarTomcatServer. Also borrowed some code from https://github.com/jsimone/webapp-runner

        Authors:
        Burt Beckwith

          • public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

            Start the server.

            Parameters:
            args - optional, these are supported
            • workDir, defaults to 'java.io.tmpdir' system property
            • context, defaults to ''
            • host, defaults to 'localhost'
            • port, defaults to 8080
            • httpsPort, no default
            • keystorePath or javax.net.ssl.keyStore, no default
            • keystorePassword or javax.net.ssl.keyStorePassword, no default
            • truststorePath or javax.net.ssl.trustStore, no default
            • trustStorePassword or javax.net.ssl.trustStorePassword, no default
            • enableCompression, defaults to true
            • compressableMimeTypes defaults to ''
            • enableClientAuth defaults to false
            • sessionTimeout, defaults to 30 (minutes)
            • nio or tomcat.nio, defaults to true
            In addition, if you specify a value that is the name of a system property (e.g. 'home.dir'), the system property value will be used.

          • @java.lang.Overridede protect protected void start(java.io.File exploded)

          • protected void startKillSwitchThread(int serverPort)

          • protected void startTomcat(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String contextPath, java.lang.Integer securePort)
